description: TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H.J. RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT CONGRESS ADJOURN FROM 12/24 TO 1/3.
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 8, A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE PAYMENT OF PROPERTY LOST DURING THE SEMINOLE WAR.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION ENTITLING R. MALLARY TO A SEAT IN THE HOUSE.
TO PASS S. 3, (APP. 1/28/1820), A BILL FOR THE RELIEF OF MATTHEW BARROW.
TO ADJOURN.
TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1, (APP. 3/16/1820, 3 STAT. 545), A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE ADMISSION OF MISSOURI INTO THE UNION AND PROHIBITING SLAVERY IN CERTAIN TERRITORIES.
TO COMMIT TO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE, THE SENATE AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 17 (APP. 3/3/1820), A BILL ADMITTING MAINE INTO THE UNION AND EXTENDING U.S. LAWS TO INCLUDE SAID STATE.
TO DISAGREE WITH THE SENATE AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 17 CONNECTING H.R. 1 WITH H.R. 17.
TO DISAGREE WITH THE RESIDUE OF THE SENATE AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 17, WHICH AMENDMENTS OUTLINES THE DETAILS OF ADDING H.R.1 TO H.R. 17, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE COMPROMISE AMENDMENT.
TO DISAGREE WITH THE SENATE AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 17, PROHIBITING SLAVERY IN THE LOUISIANA TERRITORY EXCEPT IN MISSOURI, AND PROVIDING FOR THE RETURN OF FUGITIVE SLAVES.
TO INSIST ON DISAGREEMENT TO THE SENATE AMENDMENTS TO H.R.17 ADDING H.R.1 TO H.R.17.
TO INSIST ON DISAGREEMENT TO THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R.17, PROHIBITING SLAVERY IN THE LOUISIANA TERRITORY EXCEPT IN MISSOURI, AND PROVIDING FOR THE RETURN OF FUGITIVE SLAVES.

TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT TO H.R.1 BY PROVIDING THAT THESE PROPOSITIONS BE OFFERED TO THE STATE CONSTITUTIONAL CONVENTION: THAT FUTURE SLAVERY BE ABOLISHED IN MISSOURI; THAT FUGITIVE SLAVES BE RETURNED TO OWNERS.
TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT AS IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE, TO H.R.1, WHICH AMENDMENT ABOLISHES FUTURE SLAVERY IN MISSOURI AND PROVIDES FOR THE RETURN OF FUGITIVE SLAVES.
TO AMEND H.R.1 BY PROVIDING THAT THE TERRITORY OF MISSOURI BE ADMITTED TO THE UNION IF THEIR CONSTITUTION IS APPROVED BY CONGRESS.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H.R.1.
TO PASS H.R.1.
TO CONCUR IN THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R.1, WHICH AMENDMENT ELIMINATES THE PROVISIONS PROHIBITING SLAVERY IN THE PROPOSED STATE.
TO CONCUR IN THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R.1, WHICH AMENDMENT WOULD EXCLUDE SLAVERY WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI, NORTH OF 36DEGREES 30 LATITUDE, EXCEPT IN MISSOURI.
TO AMEND THE RULES OF THE HOUSE BY PROVIDING THAT ANY MEMBER WHO DOES NOT CONFINE HIMSELF TO THE QUESTION UNDER DEBATE, NOT BE ALLOWED TO PROCEED WITHOUT LEAVE OF THE HOUSE.
TO AMEND H.R. 74 (APP. 4/14/1820), A BILL MAKING MILITARY APPROPRIATIONS FOR 1820, BY PROVIDING $495,000 FOR MEDICAL HOSPITAL, AND QUARTERMASTERS EXPENSES AND FOR THE MISSOURI EXPEDITION.
TO AMEND H.R.74, BY PROVIDING $480,000 FOR MEDICAL, HOSPITAL AND QUARTERMASTERS EXPENSES AND FOR THE MISSOURI EXPEDITION.
TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT, AS IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE, TO H.R. 74, WHICH AMENDMENT APPROPRIATES $800,000 FOR FORTIFICATIONS.
TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT, AS IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE, TO H.R. 74, WHICH AMENDMENT APPROPRIATES FUNDS FOR EXPENSES OF WEST POINT ACADEMY.
TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT, AS IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE, TO H.R. 74, WHICH AMENDMENT APPROPRIATES $2,766,440 FOR PAYMENT OF REVOLUTIONARY PENSIONS.
TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 86 (APP. 4/11/1820), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR 1820, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES FUNDS FOR PAYMENT OF CONTRACTS FOR CONSTRUCTION OF THE CUMBERLAND ROAD.
TO REJECT H.R. 108, A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE PRESERVATION AND REPAIR OF THE CUMBERLAND ROAD AND FOR THE COLLECTION OF TOLLS.
TO ADJOURN BECAUSE OF THE DEATH OF COMMODORE DECATUR.
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 79, A BILL AMENDING THE ACT PROVIDING FOR REVOLUTIONARY PENSIONS.
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY CONSIDERATION OF S. 4, A BILL AUTHORIZING SUBSCRIPTION TO 500 COPIES OF VOLUMES 11 AND 12 OF WAITE'S COMPILATION OF CONGRESSIONAL DOCUMENTS.
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY CONSIDERATION OF S. 29, A BILL COMPENSATING LOSSES FOR PROPERTY USED BY THE MILITARY IN THE SEMINOLE WAR, AND PROVIDING RELIEF OF OFFICERS AND VOLUNTEERS IN SAID WAR.

TO PASS H.R. 110 (APP. 3/12/1820), A BILL AMENDING THE ACT PROVIDING FOR THE PUBLICATION OF THE LAWS OF THE U.S., BY REDUCING THE NUMBER OF PUBLISHERS OF THE U.S. LAWS, AND REDUCING THE ALLOWANCE FOR THE EXECUTION OF THE WORK.
TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT, AS IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE, TO THE RESOLUTION ON THE PETITION OF WILLIAM HENDERSON, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT HIS PETITION BE GRANTED.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION EXCLUDING GALES AND SEATON OF THE NATIONAL INTELLEGENCER AS REPORTERS OF HOUSE PROCEEDINGS, UNLESS THEY NAME THE AUTHOR OF THE INCORRECT PUBLISHED REPORT.

TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY CONSIDERATION OF S. 23, (APP. 4/11/1820), A BILL PROVIDING FOR REMISSION OF THE FORFEITURE INCURRED BY DELISLE, DUDLEY AND VAN CLEEF, UPON ACCIDENTAL IMPORTATION OF SIX SLAVES.
TO AMEND H.R. 122 (APP. 5/1/1820), AN ACT IN ADDITION TO THE ACT OF 3/18/1818 PROVIDING THAT OFFICERS RECEIVE $8 A MONTH AS DO ALL OTHER PENSIONEERS.

TO AMEND H.R. 122 BY STRIKING ALL AFTER THE ENACTING CLAUSE AND SUBSTITUTING PROVISION REPEALING THE LAW PROVIDING PENSIONS FOR THOSE ENGAGED IN LAND OR NAVAL SERVICE DURING THE REVOLUTIONARY WAR, (APP. 3/18/1818).
TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 122 UNTIL THE NEXT SESSION OF CONGRESS.
TO PASS H.R. 122.
TO PASS S. 23 (APP 4/11/1820), A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE REMISSION OF THE FORFEITURE INCURRED BY DELISLE, DUDLEY AND VAN CLEEF, UPON ACCIDENTAL IMPORTATION OF 6 SLAVES.
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY CONSIDERATION OF S. 13 (APP. 4/11/1820), A BILL FOR THE REMISSION OF DUTIES PAID BY CERTAIN PERSONS ON GOODS IMPORTED INTO CASTINE.
TO CONCUR, AS IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE, IN DISAGREEMENT TO THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 74, WHICH AMENDMENT RAISES THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE QUARTERMASTERS DEPARTMENT AND THE MISSOURI EXPEDITION.
TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION OF A S.J. RESOLUTION FIXING THE DAY OF FINAL ADJOURNMENT OF CONGRESS, UNTIL 4/17/1820.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL NEXT SESSION, CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 65 (APP. 5/1/1820), A BILL CONCERNING WASHINGTON D.C. BANKS.

TO RECOMMIT TO THE COMMITTEE ON THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, H.R. 65 (APP. 5/1/1820), A BILL CONCERNING BANKS IN SAID DISTRICT, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REPORT A BILL ESTABLISHING 3 BANKS WITH CAPITOL NOT EXCEEDING ONE MILLION DOLLARS EACH.

TO CONCUR IN THE REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE ON H.R. 14, A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE SURVIVING OFFICERS OF THE REVOLUTION, WHICH REPORT ELIMINATES THE PROVISION AUTHORIZING HALF PAY FOR LIFE OF SAID OFFICERS, PROVIDED AMOUNT DOES NOT EXCEED 1 MILLIN DOLLARS.
TO DISCHARGE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FROM FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 113, A BILL REGULATING DUTIES ON IMPORTS AND TONNAGE.
TO PROCEED TO CONSIDERATION OF THE REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE ON THE PROPOSED AMENDMENT TO THE CONSTITUTION, WHICH AMENDMENT TREATS OF APPOINTMENT TO PUBLIC OFFICE.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE RESOLUTION PROPOSING A CONSTITUTIONAL AMENDMENT PROHIBITING A CONGRESSMAN FROM BEING APPOINTED TO PUBLIC OFFICE DURING HIS TERM IN CONGRESS AND ONE YEAR THEREAFTER.
TO DISCHARGE THE SELECT COMMITTEE FROM THEIR DUTY OF CONSIDERING A RESOLUTION FIXING THE DAY FOR ADJOURNMENT OF THE PRESENT CONGRESS.
TO PROCEED TO CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION AUTHORIZING THE SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE AND THE PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE TO FIX THE DAY OF ADJOURNMENT OF THE PRESENT SESSION OF CONGRESS.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION INSTRUCTING THE COMMITTEE ON MANUFACTURES TO REPORT WITH EVIDENCE AND ESTIMATES WHICH AREAS OF MANUFACTURING NEED ADDITIONAL ENCOURAGEMENT.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H.R. 88, A BILL CONFIRMING THE TITLE OF THE MOHICCAN INDIANS TO CERTAIN LANDS IN INDIANA.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION ASKING THE OPINION OF THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY ON THE PROBABLE REVENUE CONSEQUENCES OF THE PROPOSED TARIFF BILL.

TO CONCUR IN THE REFUSAL OF THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE TO ELIMINATE THOSE SECTIONS OF S. 18 (APP. 402401820), A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE SALE OF PUBLIC LANDS, WHICH REQUIRE CASH PAYMENT FOR LAND PURCHASES.
TO PASS S. 18 (APP. 4/24/1820), A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE SALE OF PUBLIC LANDS.
TO AMEND S. 59, A BILL PROVIDING FOR CLOTHING THE ARMY IN DOMESTIC MANUFACTURES, BY ELIMINATING THE PROVISO THAT DOMESTIC GOODS BE PROCURED AT THE SAME PRICE AS IMPORTED GOODS OF COMPARABLE QUALITY.
TO AMEND S. 59, A BILL PROVIDING FOR CLOTHING THE ARMY IN DOMESTIC MANUFACTURES, BY PROHIBITING CONTRACTS FOR DOMESTIC GOODS TO BE MORE THAN 5% ABOVE PRICES FOR COMPARABLE IMPORTED GOODS.
TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 113, A BILL REGULATING THE DUTIES ON IMPORTS AND TONNAGE, UNTIL THE FIRST DAY OF THE NEXT SESSION.
TO AMEND H.R. 113 BY REDUCING THE DUTY ON IMPORTED SALT TO 20 CENTS A BUSHEL.
TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H.R. 113.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H.R. 113.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 113 TO THE COMMITTEE ON MANUFACTURES WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REDUCE THE DUTY ON IMPORTED IRON BARS TO 75 CENTS PER HUNDREDWEIGHT.
TO POSTPONE H.R. 113 TO FIRST DAY OF NEXT SESSION.
TO PASS H.R. 113.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION FIXING THE TIME OF FINAL ADJOURNMENT OF PRESENT SESSION OF CONGRESS.
TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION UNTIL NEXT MONDAY OF THE RESOLUTION FIXING THE TIME FOR ADJOURNMENT OF PRESENT SESSION OF CONGRESS.

TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT, AS IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE, TO H.R. 50, A BILL REGULATING THE PAYMENT OF DUTIES ON IMPORTS, BY ELIMINATING THE PROVISION THAT DUTIES BE PAID BEFORE LANDING WITH CERTAIN EXCEPTIONS.
TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 51, A BILL LAYING DUTIES ON CERTAIN SALES OF MERCHANDISE AT AUCTION.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H.R. 51.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE REJECTING ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H.R. 51.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H.R. 51.
TO PASS H.R. 51.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE PASSING H.R. 51.
TO POSTPONE H.R. 51 UNTIL THE NEXT SESSION OF CONGRESS.

TO PROCEED TO CONSIDERATION OF THE JOINT HOUSE RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT REVOLUTIONARY PENSION PAYMENTS COMING DUE BEFORE 9/4/1820 BE PAID AS IF H.R. 122 HAD NOT BEEN PASSED. H.R. 122 (APP. 5/1/1820) IS A BILL IN ADDITION TO THE ACT OF 3/18/1818 PROVIDIN FOR REVOLUTIONARY PENSIONS.
TO REFER TO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE, THE JOINT HOUSE RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT PENSION PAYMENT COMING DUE BEFORE 9/4/1820 BE PAID AS IF H.R. 122 HAD NOT BEEN PASSED.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE JOINT HOUSE RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT PENSION PAYMENT COMING DUE BEFORE 9/4/1820 BE PAID AS IF H.R. 122 HAD NOT BEEN PASSED.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H.R. 148 (APP. 5/10/1820), A BILL PROVIDING THAT THE NEXT SESSION OF CONGRESS BEGIN ON THE SECOND MONDAY IN NOV.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION SUSPENDING H.R. 122 FOR A LIMITED TIME.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION TO PROVIDE BY LAW FOR OUTFIT AND SALARY FOR U.S. MINISTERS TO GOVERNMENTS OF SOUTH AMERICA.

TO CONCUR IN THE RESOLUTION, AS IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE, TO PROVIDE BY LAW FOR OUTFIT AND SALARY FOR U.S. MINISTERS TO GOVERNMENTS OF SOUTH AMERICA; AND THAT IT IS EXPEDIENT TO OCCUPY EAST AND WEST FLORIDA.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO NEGOTIATE WITH FOREIGN NATIONS ON THE MEANS OF ABOLITION OF ALL SLAVE TRADE.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 88 (APP. 5/15/1820), A BILL AUTHORIZING THE BUILDING OF CERTAIN SMALL WAR VESSELS.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 98 (APP. 5/15/1820), A BILL SUPPLEMENTARY TO AN ACT ENTITLED "AN ACT CONCERNING NAVIGATION."
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 105 (APP. 5/15/1820), A BILL AUTHORIZING THE APPOINTMENT OF COMMISSIONERS TO LAY OUT THE CONTINUATION OF THE CUMBERLAND ROAD AND CERTAIN CANALS.
TO PASS H.R. 138 (APP. 5/15/1820), A BILL AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO BORROW 3 MILLION DOLLARS.
TO PASS S. 15 (APP. 5/15/1820), A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE BETTER ORGANIZATION OF THE TREASURY DEPARTMENT AND FOR THE RECOVERY OF CERTAIN U.S. MONEYS.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE JOINT RESOLUTION PROPOSING A CONSTITUTIONAL AMENDMENT RELATING TO ELECTION OF ELECTORS OF THE PRESIDENT AND VICE-PRESIDENT.
TO RECOMMIT TO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE THE RESOLUTION ADMITTING MISSOURI INTO THE UNION.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE RESOLUTION ADMITTING MISSOURI INTO THE UNION.
TO PASS H.R. 158 (APP. 12/19/1820), A BILL RELATING TO THE CLAIM OF DANIEL MCDUFF.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE JOINT RESOLUTION FOR THE TEMPORARY ADJOURNMENT OF CONGRESS FROM 12/22/1820TO 1/2/1821.

TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION INSTRUCTING THE JUDICIARY COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE U.S. TRIBUNAL POWER IN MISSOURI AND TO REPORT NECESSARY PROVISIONS FOR THE PROTECTION OF CITIZENS IF NO SUCH LEGAL TRIBUNAL EXISTS.

TO PROCEED TO CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION INSTRUCTING THE JUDICIARY COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE U.S. TRIBUNAL POWER IN MISSOURI AND TO REPORT NECESSARY PROVISIONS FOR THE PROTECTION OF CITIZENS IF NO SUCH LEGAL TRIBUNAL EXISTS.

TO PROCEED TO THE CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION INSTRUCTING THE JUDICIARY COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE U.S. TRIBUNAL POWER IN MISSOURI AND TO REPORT NECESSARY PROVISIONS FOR THE PROTECTION OF CITIZENS IF NO SUCH LEGAL TRIBUNAL EXISTS.
TO AMEND THE JOURNAL ENTRY OF 1/11/1821 DEALING WITH MEMORIALS SUBMITTED BY THE GOVERNMENT OF MISSOURI, TO READ THE "STATE OF" MISSOURI. (THE SPEAKER VOTING NAY.)
TO AMEND THE JOURNAL ENTRY OF 1/11/1821 DEALING WITH MEMORIALS SUBMITTED BY THE GOVERNMENT OF MISSOURI, TO READ THE "TERRITORY OF" MISSOURI.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE REJECTING THE AMENDMENT TO THE JOURNAL ENTRY OF 1/11/1821 DEALING WITH MEMORIALS SUBMITTED BY THE GOVERNMENT OF MISSOURI, TO READ THE "STATE OF" MISSOURI.
TO AMEND THE JOURNAL ENTRY OF 1/11/1821 DEALING WITH MEMORIALS SUBMITTED BY THE GOVERNMENT OF MISSOURI, TO READ "THE LATE TERRITORY OF" MISSOURI.
TO PROCEED TO CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION CONCERNING THE SPEAKER'S AND THE HOUSE'S OBLIGATION AND RIGHTS IN AMENDING THE JOURNAL.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H.R. 180 (APP. 3/2/1821, 3 STAT.615), A BILL REDUCING THE MILITARY PEACE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE ARMY.
TO PASS H.R. 180 (APP. 3/2/1821, 3 STAT. 615), A BILL REDUCING THE MILITARY PEACE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE ARMY.

TO AMEND BY SUBSTITUTION H.R. 93, (APP. 3/2/1821), A BILL FOR THE RELIEF OF THE FAMILY OF THE LATE COMMODORE PERRY, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT HALF PAY FOR 5 YEARS BE GIVEN TO HIS FAMILY AS PRESCRIBED IN THE ACT OF 3/4/1814.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H.R. 93 (APP. 3/2/1821), A BILL FOR THE RELIEF OF THE FAMILY OF THE LATE COMMODORE PERRY.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT THE PROPOSED CONSTITUTION OF THE STATE OF MISSOURI BE AMENDED TO ELIMINATE THE SECTION REQUIRING THE STATE LEGISLATURE TO PASS LAWS PROHIBITING FREE NEGROES AND MULATTOES FROM SETTLIG IN MISSOURI.
TO ADOPT THE JOINT RESOLUTION AMENDING THE CONSTITUTION BY ESTABLISHING A UNIFORM MODE OF ELECTING, BY DISTRICTS, ELECTORS OF PRESIDENT, VICE-PRESIDENT AND REPRESENTATIVES.
TO PASS S. 6 (APP. 2/9/1821), A BILL INCORPORATING COLUMBIAN COLLEGE IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.

TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT MADE IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE TO THE RESOLUTION RELATIVE TO THE ADMISSION OF MISSOURI INTO THE UNION, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT NO LAW OF SAID STATE DISCRIMINATE BETWEEN CITIZENS OF THE SEVERAL STATES.
TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION RELATIVE TO THE ADMISSION OF MISSOURI INTO THE UNION, BY PROHIBITING THE PASSING OF LAWS PREVENTING ANY U.S. CITIZEN FROM SETTLING IN MISSOURI.

TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT MADE IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE TO THE RESOLUTION ON NAVAL AFFAIRS, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT THE NUMBER OF CAPTAINS, MASTERS, COMMANDANTS, LIEUTENANTS AND MIDSHIPMEN IN THE NAVY NOT BE REDUCED.
TO AMEND H.R. 227 (APP. 3/3/1821), A BILL MAKING GENERAL APPROPRIATIONS FOR 1821, BY APPROPRIATING $18,000 FOR A MINISTER TO ANY INDEPENDENT SOUTH AMERICAN GOVERNMENT.
TO ADOPT THE FIRST CLAUSE OF THE RESOLUTION ON SOUTH AMERICAN PROVINCES, WHICH CLAUSE PROVIDES THAT THE HOUSE AND THE AMERICAN PEOPLE ARE INTERESTED IN THE SUCCESS OF THE STRUGGLES OF SOUTH AMERICA.
TO ADOPT THE SECOND CLAUSE OF THE RESOLUTION ON SOUTH AMERICAN PROVINCES, WHICH CLAUSE PROVIDES THAT THE HOUSE WILL SUPPORT ANY PRESIDENTIAL RECOGNITION OF INDEPENDENT SOUTH AMERICAN GOVERNMENTS.
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING FOR THE ADMISSION OF MISSOURI INTO THE UNION.

TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT OF THE SELECT COMMITTEE TO THE RESOLUTION RELATED TO THE ADMISSION OF MISSOURI INTO THE UNION; WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT THE STATE NEVER PASS LAWS PREVENTING CITIZENS FROM SETTLING IN MISSOURI; WHICH AMENDED AMENDMENT PROHIBITSSLAVERY IN MISSOURI.

TO CONCUR IN THE DISAGREEMENT OF THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE TO THE REPORT OF THE SELECT COMMITTEE ON THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT MISSOURI NOT BE ADMITTED TO THE UNION UNLESS SHE AGREE BY PUBLIC ACT NEVER TO PASS A LAW PREVENTING ANY U.S. CITIZEN FROM STTLING THEREIN.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE AMENDED RESOLUTION RELATING TO THE ADMISSION OF MISSOURI INTO THE UNION.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE REJECTING ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE AMENDED RESOLUTION ON THE ADMISSION OF MISSOURI INTO THE UNION.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE AMENDED RESOLUTION ON THE ADMISSION OF MISSOURI INTO THE UNION.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING FOR THE ASSEMBLY OF CONGRESS TO COUNT THE ELECTORAL VOTE FOR PRESIDENT AND VICE-PRESIDENT.

TO ADJOURN, DURING CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION STATING THAT THE ELECTORAL VOTE OF MISSOURI CONSTITUTES PART OF THE 231 VOTE MAJORITY FOR PRESIDENT; AND THAT THE VOTES HAVE NOT BEEN ANNOUNCED BY THE PRESIDING OFFICERS, AND THEREFORE THE PROCEEDINGS WEE ILLEGAL.

TO AMEND H.R. 249, (APP. 2/20/1821), A BILL EQUALIZING THE PAY OF ARMY OFFICERS, BY REPEALING ALL LAWS ALLOWING PAY AND RATIONS TO MILITARY ACADEMY CADETS AND RELEASING SAID CADETS FROM FURTHER MILITARY OBLIGATIONS.
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY S. 28 (APP. 3/2/1821), A BILL SETTLING THE PENSION CLAIM OF CAPT. S. TUCKER.
TO PASS H.R. 249 (APP. 2/20/1821), A BILL EQUALIZING THE PAY OF ARMY OFFICERS.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 28 (APP. 3/2/1821), A BILL SETTLING THE PENSION CLAIM OF CAPT. S. TUCKER. SPEAKER VOTING IN THE AFFIRMATIVE.
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY H.R. 247, A BILL REDUCING SALARIES AND FIXING A MAXIMUM COMPENSATION OF CERTAIN CIVIL OFFICERS.
TO PASS S. 28 (APP. 3/2/1821), A BILL SETTLING THE PENSION CLAIM OF CAPT. S. TUCKER.
TO ADOPT THE JOINT RESOLUTION APPOINTING A JOINT CONGRESSIONAL COMMITTEE TO CONSIDER AND REPORT ON THE EXPEDIENCY OF ADMITTING MISSOURI INTO THE UNION AND UPON WHAT CONDITIONS.
TO AMEND S. 16 (APP. 3/2/1821), A BILL MAKING FURTHER PROVISIONS FOR THE SALE OF PUBLIC LAND AND FIXING PRICES, BY ALLOWING A 25% DISCOUNT FOR PROMPT PAYMENT.
TO ORDER THE MAIN QUESTION ON ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE RESOLUTION RELATING TO THE ADMISSION OF MISSOURI INTO THE UNION.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE RESOLUTION RELATING TO THE ADMISSION OF MISSOURI INTO THE UNION.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION RELATING TO THE ADMISSION OF MISSOURI INTO THE UNION.
TO AMEND H.R. 180, (APP. 3/2/1821, 3 STAT.), A BILL REDUCING THE MILITARY PEACE ESTABLISHMENT, BY ELIMINATING THE PROVISION FOR A MAJOR GENERAL AND 2 AIDS-DE-CAMP.
TO AMEND S. 16 (APP. 3/2/1821), A BILL FOR THE RELIEF OF PURCHASERS OF PUBLIC LAND PRIOR TO 7/1/20, BY REDUCING PAYMENT BY 37 AND 1/2% UNTIL 9/30/1822.
TO PASS S. 16 (APP. 3/2/1821), A BILL FOR THE RELIEF OF PURCHASERS OF PUBLIC LAND PRIOR TO 7/1/1820.
TO PROCEED TO CONSIDERATION OF S. 20, A BILL PROVIDING A UNIFORM SYSTEM OF BANKRUPTCY.
TO ADJOURN, DURING CONSIDERATION OF S. 20.
TO ADJOURN, DURING CONSIDERATION OF S. 20.
TO POSTPONE S. 20 INDEFINITELY.
TO TABLE S. 20.
TO TABLE S. 20.
TO AMEND H.R. 263 (APP. 3/3/1821), A BILL MAKING MILITARY APPROPRIATIONS OF 1821, BY APPROPRIATING $40,000 TO PAY ARREARS OF THE COST OF ERECTION OF THE ARSENAL AT AUGUSTA, GA.
TO AMEND H.R. 263, BY APPROPRIATING $30,000 FOR FORTIFICATIONS AT MOBILE POINT.
TO AMEND H.R. 263, BY APPROPRIATING $30,000 FOR FORTIFICATIONS AT DAUPHIN ISLAND.
TO AMEND H.R. 184 (APP. 3/3/1821), A BILL AMENDING THE ACT INCREASING THE NAVY, BY REDUCING THE NUMBER OF YEARS FROM 6 TO 3 THAT $500,000 IS APPROPRIATED FOR CONSTRUCTION OF SHIPS AND EQUIPMENT.
TO CONSIDER S. 20.
TO RECOMMIT H. R. 17 (3 STAT. 544, 3/3/1820), A BILL PROVI- DING FOR THE ADMISSION OF THS STATE OF MAINE TO THE UNION, TO THE COMMITEE ON THE JUDICIARY WITH INSTRUCTIONS.  (P.101)

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF A RESOLUTION, AMENDING THE CONSTITUTION SO AS TO PROVIDE A UNIFORM METHOD OF ELECTING ELECTORS FOR PRESIDENT AND VICE PRESIDENT AND REPRESENTATIVES IN CONGRESS.  (P.233)

TO AMEND THE CONSTITUTIONAL RESOLUTION BY ELIMINATING THE CLAUSE THAT PERSONS QUALIFIED TO VOTE FOR REPRESENTATIVES IN EACH DISTRICT SHALL CHOOSE ONE ELECTOR, AND THAT THE TWO ADDITIONAL TO WHICH EACH STATE IS ENTITLED SHALL BE APPOINT- ED AS THE LEGISLAURE DIRECTS; AND INSERTING IN LIEU THEREOF A PROVISION THAT EACH STATE SHALL BE DIVIDED INTO DISTRICTS EQUAL TO THE NUMBER OF ELECTORS TO WHICH EACH STATE IS EN- TITLED AND PEOPLE QUALIFIED TO VOTE IN EACH DISTRICT SHALL CHOOSE ONE ELECTOR
TO ADOPT THE CONSTITUTIONAL RESOLUTION.  (P.278)
TO AMEND H. R. 17 (3 STAT. 545, 3/6/1820), BY PROHIBITING SLAVERY OR INVOLUNTARY SERVITUDE IN THE ADMISSION OF THE STATE OF MISSOURI TO THE UNION.  (P.359)

TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT TO THE H. R. 17, WHICH AMENDMENT UNITES THE MAINE AND MISSOURI BILLS IN ONE BILL AND AUTHOR- IZES THE PEOPLE OF MISSOURI TO FORM A CONSTITUTION WITHOUT RESTRICTIONS.  (P.74)
TO AMEND H. R. 17, BY CHANGING THE DEFINITION OF THE TERRI- TORY IN WHICH SLAVERY IS PROHIBITED.  (P.427)
TO PASS AMENDMENT TO H. R. 17, WHICH AMENDMENT PROHIBITS SLAVERY IN ALL THAT TERRITORY CEDED BY FRANCE TO THE U. S., AND PERMITS EXTRADITION OF ANY SLAVE ESCAPING INTO SAME. (P.428)
